Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the body of a orange-red pottery vessel, the fabric is very thick, relatively coarse and pink in section, the interior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is ribbed, elaborated with cord-marked decoration and covered with a self-slip.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394822) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394822)
